title: New calendar appointment view is inferior to prior view
text:
I started Teams this morning an encountered a delay in opening the app which was ‚Äúupdating‚Äù my view. An ominous start‚Ä¶

The new paneled/columnar view on iOS for teams uses screen real estate very poorly. I now have 20% of my screen to find my one of hundred of appointments via a stupid infinite scroll or by tapping on a tiny monthly calendar view that takes up 5% of my screen. Do you people only have 2 appointments on your calendar that this is OK? Moreover a whopping 60% of my screen is dedicated to a ‚Äúselect an item to view‚Äù which presumably populates once I find said appointment. How about making this appear in a context dependent setting once you click on an appointment? Also, I‚Äôm unclear on how one goes about switching back. Maybe this new view is great for someone else, but it is garbage to me, rendering it mostly unusable. So instead I‚Äôll go to outlook to open a teams appointment. Feels a bit silly.

title: Once you go Teams, there‚Äôs no turning back
text: Teams blows every other solution out of the water. It really should be marketed as consumer alternatives to Zoom as well. Once you‚Äôve used Teams, no other video and chat solution will feel adequate again.

title: Solid app; minor annoyances
text:
Overall the Teams app is very good and I‚Äôm glad to use it most of the time. I‚Äôve had only one issue with basic functionality but otherwise it‚Äôs been rock-solid.

In terms of issues and annoyances, the biggest issue for me is that my most common use case for using the app is to join the audio of a call I‚Äôve already joined from my laptop. However when I do this, the options Teams presents me with are to transfer the call or join without audio, neither of which do I want to do. So I end up joining a call on my laptop, then joining on my phone and transferring the call (I have to do it in this order due to a Teams platform design issue), then finally re-joining on my laptop. It‚Äôs a huge hassle when a simple option to join without either transferring or losing audio (or, better yet, joining audio only) is all I need.

Another behavior of this app I dislike is that it logs call history in the iPhone‚Äôs native Phone app. I‚Äôm not sure if that‚Äôs due to Microsoft or Apple‚Äôs call design but it is highly undesirable as I do not like my work matters to bleed into my personal apps on my personal phone. 

The final annoyance is that the volume level is often too high for me, and the ability to control it is restricted. Often I am trying to turn the volume down but it is already at the lowest level my iPhone allows. It seems I am always using the 10-40% volume range, so I‚Äôm cramped in my ability to fine-tune loudness as different voices (of varying volume) speak on a call. Even the ability to reduce volume below the lowest iPhone ‚Äúnotch‚Äù doesn‚Äôt work as the volume just reverts (although this may be an iPhone design issue as well related to calls, but I never feel the volume is too loud in calls). (For what it‚Äôs worth, the issue of loudness in Teams calls is also present on my laptop, where I typically keep my volume at somewhere between 2 and 8 out of 100-point scale, with anything over about 35-40 being deafening, so I suspect this is a platform problem just ‚Äúinherited‚Äù by the app.)

There have also been a few bugs, but the only one I was able to replicate consistently was that if I joined a call from my laptop on the web first *without audio*, then joined from my phone, I would not be able to unmute in the mobile app.

All in all, though, this is a pretty good app.

title: Teams works well but the spell checking could be improved.

title: Better than the iPad version
text: My wife and I tried to get on an important call today using the iPad version, and it would not allow us to connect with the meeting. We double checked the Meeting ID and Passcode at least 4‚Äì5 times, and not go. The great part is, their iPhone version allowed us to connect with no issues. Would have given a higher review, if it wasn‚Äôt for the poorly designed iPad version that made us late to a very important meeting.

title: Not the same as iPhone version
text: I had to join a meeting that was outside of our company, and when tried to enter the Meeting ID and Password, and it could not find the meeting. Went to my iPhone after five attempts and was able to get in with no problems. Probably one of the biggest frustrations I have with the iPad version.

text: Much elegant and comfortable, keeps you connected in work and meetings if you would step away from laptop.

title: Stand alone messenger
text:
Imagine purchasing a cell phone, and the only people you can communicate with are people with the same cell provider. 
Teams is a good tool, but what would make it an awesome tool, is if it could interface not only with teams, but discord, slack, and other messaging services. 
The same way an android T-Mobile cell phone can speak and work with an AT&T Cell phone, or a cricket flip-phone.

title: The ‚Äúfix‚Äù broke it
text: The last update caused my teams to no longer ring on my phone. I‚Äôve had to make a mad dash to my office because I could hear it ringing on my desktop but it was not ringing on my cellphones. Notifications are allowed, nothing is turned on for blocking and I‚Äôve reset my device and it still doesn‚Äôt ring

title: disables chats frequently
text:
The Microsoft teams app is nice when it works. 

Unfortunately, l have to delete the app and reinstall it every couple of weeks, because it disables my chats. When that happens, I can read the chats, like them, but not respond to them. 

This never happens on my computer, just my phone. 
And although deleting and reinstalling the app temporarily fixes the problem, it is annoying and l would love for Microsoft to find a solution to this problem.

title: Desktop shifts different than mobile shifts
text: I have triple checked over the past year. The mobile app will show 2 employees working at the same time, but on my desktop it only shows 1. The desktop is right, but my employees rely on the mobile app. This is very frustrating.

title: No Videos
text:
13 seconds of puppy video is too hardcore for this multi-billion dollar corporation‚Äôs ‚ÄúProductivity‚Äù application.

If I could rate 0/5 stars I would.

-An extremely concerned participant

title: Server
text: Would be nice to be in more of a server format. Where you can set specific tags(positions) only allowing them to see what is necessary in the server. Instead of a teams group that has various members/ positions attached that do not correlate directly. I feel like this could be a massive push for Microsoft (Teams). It would allow quicker interactions with better response time.

title: Perfect tool for work
text:
I work remotely and absolutely love the teams app. I‚Äôm able to get information and respond within seconds.

I had 2 jobs at one point that used teams to communicate love that I‚Äôm able to have multiple accounts within the app. 

Absolutely recommend using Teams for all your communication needs personal and business.
